Dear Tanual Gaskew:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact the area
manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was placed at House of Love on 8/8/23. On 8/10/23 there
was an escalated incident involving youth and multiple staff,
notably the Chief Administrator (CA). During an unannounced visit
by Licensing on 8/15/23, CA described the incident as youth
attacking CA, including being punched and having hair pulled out.
CA stated that for CA’s safety, CA decided to “take youth down.”
Youth reported to licensing youth attacked CA and was eventually
restrained. Youth also stated having been kneed in the face by the
CA. House of Love does not restrain as a part of their
programming. Youth reported no injuries, and none were visible.
Investigation On 8/25/2023 telephone call with complainant. No additional
concerns noted.
On 08/25/2023 an on-site visit occurred at House of Love. A
meeting occurred with Program Manager (PM). She was
advised of assigned special investigation and informed of the
allegations. PM indicated she was familiar with the incident and
confirmed CA and Staff 2 engaged in a restraint because Youth A
was being aggressive and not following directives. PM confirmed
the agency policy does not support physical restraints. PM also
shared the agency was reviewing policy and looking at various
approved behavior management protocols that include the use of
restraints. She reported the agency is considering seeking
approval from DCWL. A safety plan was discussed. PM agreed
to implement a safety plan which included having all staff refrain
from the use of restraints until such practice is approved by DCWL
and all staff are trained.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was held with Supervisor
1 at House of Love. She confirmed date of incident from review
of documents but advised that she was not present on the day of
the incident. She confirmed she was aware of Youth B being
restrained. She confirmed no additional restraints had occurred
with Youth A or other youth in program.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was completed with
Youth A at House of Love. Youth A recalled she got into a
“fight” with CA. She stated CA slammed her knee against the wall
but does not think it was intentional. She also reported CA
pushed her in the back to get her out of the office where
confidential information is stored. Youth A reported she hit CA
and was restrained by CA. She also reported Staff 2 was present.
She was holding her arms and CA was sitting on her knees.
Youth A denied she was hurt during the restraint and denied being
2

engaged in a restraint since that day. She reported staff use
redirection, discussion and positive praise as behavior
management plans.
On 09/06/2023 an in-person meeting was completed with
Youth B at House of Love. She reported she is aware of the
incident that occurred with staff and Youth A, but denied she saw
any of it or can speak to what occurred.
On 09/12/2023 a video interview was completed with Chief
Administrator (CA). She confirmed she held Youth A down on
8/10/23 because she was out of control, and she wanted to stop
her from harming herself or someone else. CA confirmed the
agency has a behavior management plan that does not support
going “hands on” with youth at the program. She also confirmed
House of Love staff have not been trained in proper use of
physical restraints. She denied pulling the hair of Youth A and
denied pushing her against the wall with her knees. CA reported
that Youth A was not following directives to remove herself from
the office area and continued to escalate in tone and behavior
despite verbal attempts to deescalate. CA reported in an attempt
prevent harm to the youth and others, she safely took her down to
the ground and held her down on the ground until she calmed
down. CA also asked Staff 2 to assist by holding the hands and
arms of Youth A.
On 09/12/2023 a video interview was completed with Staff 2.
She confirmed she was present on 8/10/23 when Youth A began
to act out. She confirmed CA was holding Youth A down to the
ground. She reported CA safely took Youth A down to the ground
and was then laying on top of her. Staff 2 advised she was asked
to hold her hands and arms because Youth A continued trying to
hit CA. She confirmed she has not been trained at House of Love
on the proper way to restrain a youth to prevent harm. Staff 2 also
confirmed the agency policy does not allow going “hands on”.
She denied seeing CA pull Youth A’s hair or intentionally hit her.
She reported CA was just trying to get Youth A to relax and calm
down.
Video Review:
On 09/12/2023 an email was sent to Program Manager. She was
asked to provide a copy of the video footage from 08/10/2023 that
documented the incident. PM replied and indicated that she no
longer had access to the footage due to power outages in their
area.
3

Documents reviewed:
House of Love Behavior Management Policy – Policy identifies
House of Love Agency as a “non-restraint” facility. It specifically
indicates the approach is non-restraint in a crisis or situation
where a child's behavior becomes challenging.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in non-compliance with licensing rule R400.4109 (1)(c). The
agency has a current policy that documents the agency will not
utilize restraint for youth placed in the program. All staff and youth
interviewed confirmed that a restraint occurred.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
